title: Ann Linde named Sweden’s foreign minister
text:
Ann Linde is a Social Democratic party veteran who most recently held the position of minister for foreign trade | Jonas Ekstromer/AFP via Getty Images Ann Linde named Sweden’s foreign minister Margot Wallström stepped down on Friday.

Sweden’s Ann Linde was on Tuesday named the country’s new foreign minister, following the resignation of Margot Wallström.

A former minister for EU affairs and trade, Linde is a Social Democratic party veteran who most recently held the position of minister for foreign trade, a role she was appointed to in January.

Linde was announced after Wallström on Friday stepped down from the post she has held since 2014, citing family reasons.

“I have put everything I have into the job of making Sweden safe, respected internationally and appreciated as a partner,” she said according to Reuters. “It is time for me to spend more time with my husband, my children and my grandchildren.”

The departing foreign minister gained attention after she was banned from Israel for backing an investigation into whether Palestinian assailants were victims of “extrajudicial killings.” A former vice president of the European Commission, Wallström also sparked a diplomatic spat with Saudi Arabia in March 2015 after she criticized its human rights record.

While Linde has in comparison maintained a lower profile, she attracted criticism for wearing a headscarf during a visit by a government delegation to Tehran in 2017.
description: Margot Wallström stepped down on Friday.
